page.title: 05The Crudens,Voe
page.content: The Cruden houses were built just after the Second World War and were designed as temporary buildings with a life of about 10 years. Tenants first moved into the Crudens in 1949 and were in the same houses in 1984. However,by 1983 it was decided that the houses were unsafe and wooden batons were put up on the outside and inside walls to strengthen them. In October 1984 the houses were vacated and major improvements began. The families were housed in caravans and vacant council houses. Everything had to be cleared out of the houses while new brickwork walls were built,the roofs slated,central heating installed and kitchen units and bathroom suites fitted. In March 1985 the families started to move back into the renovated Crudens.
